title: Love Island Australia's Maurice Salib reveals the secret to his amazing abs
text:
Love Island Australia villain Maurice Salib was sent home from the villa on Monday night in a shock twist elimination.

And in an interview with Daily Mail Australia following his exit, the male model revealed one of the secrets behind his enviable abs.

'A little bit of what I do is intermittent fasting,' the 27-year-old hunk said.

EXCLUSIVE: Love Island Australia villain Maurice Salib (pictured) told Daily Mail Australia that intermittent fasting is one of the secrets behind his perfect six pack

Intermittent fasting is an eating pattern that involves only consuming food between a set window of time each day.

'People get really crazed about working out a lot, but everyone has abs, it's just about getting past the excess layer of skin if you'd like,' Maurice explained.

'When you intermittent fast and eat between 12 and 6pm, you certainly get there a lot faster.'

Work it: 'People get really crazed about working out a lot, but everyone has abs, it's just about getting past the excess layer of skin if you'd like,' Maurice explained

In addition to his diet secret, Maurice said that he plans to reveal some more of his fitness tips through an upcoming projects on his Instagram account in the near future.

'I'm working on something really, really, really exciting with my amazing team,' he said.

'It's to do with the performing arts, within film and music, and as part of that I'm going to be sharing some really cool things about some fitness regimes.'

'When you intermittent fast and eat between 12 and 6pm, you certainly get there a lot faster,' the 27-year-old model said

Besides his gorgeous good looks, the Egyptian stud also addressed his controversial Love Island relationship with Cynthia Taylu.

While many viewers branded the romance 'fake' and accused Maurice of using the West African model to stay on the show, he insisted to Daily Mail Australia that it was completely genuine.

'She's a lovely girl, and I think that the reason some people perceived that the relationship between Cynthia and I was a bit of a friend type of thing is because she hasn't had a boyfriend before,' he explained.

'I was surprised to leave because things were really developing': Maurice also insisted that his relationship with fellow model Cynthua Taylu was the real deal

'So it was crucial to me that I respected her and I didn't want to mislead her, so we both had this mutual agreement that we wanted to take things slow.

'I wanted things to develop on a solid foundation and she wanted the exact same thing.'

He added that the pair had shared some 'beautiful kisses and conversations' together.

'I was surprised to leave because things were really developing with Cynthia and I.'

Maurice and Vanessa Sierra were both sent home on Monday night after being dumped from the villa but their fellow islanders in a brutal vote off.
description: Love Island Australia villain Maurice Salib was sent home from the villa on Monday night in a shock twist elimination.
